obfuscation: Wo n't it be a pretty wedding ?
original: Won't it be a pretty wedding?

obfuscation: Will not Lisa look delightful ?
original: Will not Lisa look delightful?

obfuscation: Smiles and tears in plenty shedding -- Which in brides of course is rightful One could say , if one were spiteful , Contradiction little dreading , Her bouquet is simply frightful -- however , 'twill be a pretty wedding !
original:
Smiles and tears in plenty shedding--
                    Which in brides of course is rightful
                    One could say, if one were spiteful,
              Contradiction little dreading,
 	Her bouquet is simply frightful--
              Still, 'twill be a pretty wedding!

obfuscation: Oh , it is a pretty wedding !
original: Oh, it is a pretty wedding!

obfuscation: Such a pretty , pretty wedding !
original: Such a pretty, pretty wedding!

obfuscation: If her dress is badly fitting , Theirs the fault who made her trousseau .
original:
If her dress is badly fitting,
                    Theirs the fault who made her trousseau.

obfuscation: If her gloves are always splitting , Cheap kid gloves , we know , will do so .
original:
If her gloves are always splitting,
                    Cheap kid gloves, we know, will do so.

obfuscation: If upon her train she stumbled , On one 's train one 's always treading .
original:
If upon her train she stumbled,
                    On one's train one's always treading.

obfuscation: If her hair is preferably tumbled , Still , 'twill be a pretty wedding !
original:
If her hair is rather tumbled,
                    Still, 'twill be a pretty wedding!

obfuscation: Such a pretty , pretty wedding !
original: Such a pretty, pretty wedding!

obfuscation: Here they come , the couple plighted -- On life 's journey gaily start them .
original:
Here they come, the couple plighted--
                    On life's journey gaily start them.

obfuscation: Soon to be for aye united , Till divorce or death shall part them .
original:
Soon to be for aye united,
                    Till divorce or death shall part them.

obfuscation: Pretty Lisa , fair and tasty , Tell me now , and tell me truly , Have n't you been preferably hasty ?
original:
Pretty Lisa, fair and tasty,
                    Tell me now, and tell me truly,
              Haven't you been rather hasty?

obfuscation: Have n't you been rash unduly ?
original: Haven't you been rash unduly?

obfuscation: Am I quite the dashing sposo That your fancy could depict you ?
original:
Am I quite the dashing sposo
                    That your fancy could depict you?

obfuscation: Perhaps you think I 'm only so-so ?
original: Perhaps you think I'm only so-so?

obfuscation: Well , I will not contradict you !
original: Well, I will not contradict you!

obfuscation: No , he will not contradict you !
original: No, he will not contradict you!

obfuscation: Who am I to raise objection ?
original: Who am I to raise objection?

obfuscation: I 'm a child , untaught and homely -- When you tell me you 're perfection , Tender , truthful , truthful , and comely -- That in quarrel no one 's bolder , Though dissensions always grieve you -- Why , my love , you 're so much older That , of course , I must believe you !
original:
I'm a child, untaught and homely--
              When you tell me you're perfection,
                    Tender, truthful, true, and comely--
              That in quarrel no one's bolder,
                    Though dissensions always grieve you--
              Why, my love, you're so much older
                    That, of course, I must believe you!

obfuscation: Yes , of course , she must believe you !
original: Yes, of course, she must believe you!

obfuscation: If he always acts unkindly , Shut your eyes and love him blindly -- Should he call you names uncomely , Shut your mouth and love him dumbly -- Should he rate you , rightly -- leftly -- Shut your ears and love him deafly .
original:
If he ever acts unkindly,
              Shut your eyes and love him blindly--
              Should he call you names uncomely,
              Shut your mouth and love him dumbly--
              Should he rate you, rightly--leftly--
              Shut your ears and love him deafly.
